attributes.synopsis:
Gol D. Roger was known as the "Pirate King," the strongest and most infamous being to have sailed the Grand Line. The capture and death of Roger by the World Government brought a change throughout the world. His last words before his death revealed the existence of the greatest treasure in the world, One Piece. It was this revelation that brought about the Grand Age of Pirates, men who dreamed of finding One Piece—which promises an unlimited amount of riches and fame—and quite possibly the pinnacle of glory and the title of the Pirate King.
Enter Monkey D. Luffy, a 17-year-old boy who defies your standard definition of a pirate. Rather than the popular persona of a wicked, hardened, toothless pirate ransacking villages for fun, Luffy’s reason for being a pirate is one of pure wonder: the thought of an exciting adventure that leads him to intriguing people and ultimately, the promised treasure. Following in the footsteps of his childhood hero, Luffy and his crew travel across the Grand Line, experiencing crazy adventures, unveiling dark mysteries and battling strong enemies, all in order to reach the most coveted of all fortunes—One Piece.
[Written by MAL Rewrite]

attributes.synopsis:
Yuji Itadori is a boy with tremendous physical strength, though he lives a completely ordinary high school life. One day, to save a classmate who has been attacked by curses, he eats the finger of Ryomen Sukuna, taking the curse into his own soul. From then on, he shares one body with Ryomen Sukuna. Guided by the most powerful of sorcerers, Satoru Gojo, Itadori is admitted to Tokyo Jujutsu High School, an organization that fights the curses... and thus begins the heroic tale of a boy who became a curse to exorcise a curse, a life from which he could never turn back.

(Source: Crunchyroll)

(Source: Crunchyroll)

attributes.synopsis:
The second season of Baki Hanma: Son of Ogre.

In Hanma Baki’s first season, the fighter Baki — the strongest high schooler in the land — trained in a prison against fellow inmates, defeating a giant praying mantis and formidable opponents like Biscuit “Mr. Unchained” Oliva and Jun “Mr. Second” Guevaru. Now, Baki is back and gearing up to battle Pickle, a perfectly preserved prehistoric man so powerful, he once preyed on dinosaurs. If Baki can take down Pickle, his final matchup will be with his all-powerful father, Yujiro Hanma.

(Source: Netflix)

(Source: Netflix)

attributes.synopsis:
It is the Taisho Period in Japan. Tanjiro, a kindhearted boy who sells charcoal for a living, finds his family slaughtered by a demon. To make matters worse, his younger sister Nezuko, the sole survivor, has been transformed into a demon herself. Though devastated by this grim reality, Tanjiro resolves to become a “demon slayer” so that he can turn his sister back into a human, and kill the demon that massacred his family.

(Source: Crunchyroll)

attributes.synopsis:
Centuries ago, mankind was slaughtered to near extinction by monstrous humanoid creatures called titans, forcing humans to hide in fear behind enormous concentric walls. What makes these giants truly terrifying is that their taste for human flesh is not born out of hunger but what appears to be out of pleasure. To ensure their survival, the remnants of humanity began living within defensive barriers, resulting in one hundred years without a single titan encounter. However, that fragile calm is soon shattered when a colossal titan manages to breach the supposedly impregnable outer wall, reigniting the fight for survival against the man-eating abominations.

After witnessing a horrific personal loss at the hands of the invading creatures, Eren Yeager dedicates his life to their eradication by enlisting into the Survey Corps, an elite military unit that combats the merciless humanoids outside the protection of the walls. Based on Hajime Isayama's award-winning manga, Shingeki no Kyojin follows Eren, along with his adopted sister Mikasa Ackerman and his childhood friend Armin Arlert, as they join the brutal war against the titans and race to discover a way of defeating them before the last walls are breached.

(Source: MAL Rewrite)

(Source: MAL Rewrite)

attributes.synopsis:
It has been two and a half years since Naruto Uzumaki left Konohagakure, the Hidden Leaf Village, for intense training following events which fueled his desire to be stronger. Now Akatsuki, the mysterious organization of elite rogue ninja, is closing in on their grand plan which may threaten the safety of the entire shinobi world.

Although Naruto is older and sinister events loom on the horizon, he has changed little in personality—still rambunctious and childish—though he is now far more confident and possesses an even greater determination to protect his friends and home. Come whatever may, Naruto will carry on with the fight for what is important to him, even at the expense of his own body, in the continuation of the saga about the boy who wishes to become Hokage.

(Source: MAL Rewrite)

attributes.synopsis:
Hunter x Hunter is set in a world where Hunters exist to perform all manner of dangerous tasks like capturing criminals and bravely searching for lost treasures in uncharted territories. Twelve-year-old Gon Freecss is determined to become the best Hunter possible in hopes of finding his father, who was a Hunter himself and had long ago abandoned his young son. However, Gon soon realizes the path to achieving his goals is far more challenging than he could have ever imagined.

Along the way to becoming an official Hunter, Gon befriends the lively doctor-in-training Leorio, vengeful Kurapika, and rebellious ex-assassin Killua. To attain their own goals and desires, together the four of them take the Hunter Exam, notorious for its low success rate and high probability of death. Throughout their journey, Gon and his friends embark on an adventure that puts them through many hardships and struggles. They will meet a plethora of monsters, creatures, and characters—all while learning what being a Hunter truly means.

(Source: MAL Rewrite)

attributes.synopsis:
After visiting the Rengoku residence, Tanjirou and his comrades volunteer for a mission within the Entertainment District, a place where desires are sold and demons dwell. They journey alongside the flashy Sound Hashira, Tengen Uzui, in search of a monstrous foe terrorizing the town. Sworn to slay creatures of the night, the hunt continues.

(Source: Funimation)

attributes.synopsis:
What would the world be like if 80 percent of the population manifested extraordinary superpowers called “Quirks” at age four? Heroes and villains would be battling it out everywhere! Becoming a hero would mean learning to use your power, but where would you go to study? U.A. High's Hero Program of course! But what would you do if you were one of the 20 percent who were born Quirkless?

Middle school student Izuku Midoriya wants to be a hero more than anything, but he hasn't got an ounce of power in him. With no chance of ever getting into the prestigious U.A. High School for budding heroes, his life is looking more and more like a dead end. Then an encounter with All Might, the greatest hero of them all gives him a chance to change his destiny…

(Source: Viz Media)

attributes.synopsis:
When a pregnant young starlet appears in Gorou Amemiya’s countryside medical clinic, the doctor takes it upon himself to safely (and secretly) deliver Ai Hoshino’s child so she can make a scandal-free return to the stage. But no good deed goes unpunished, and on the eve of her delivery, he finds himself slain at the hands of Ai’s deluded stalker — and subsequently reborn as Ai’s child, Aquamarine Hoshino! The glitz and glamor of showbiz hide the dark underbelly of the entertainment industry, threatening to dull the shine of his favorite star. Can he help his new mother rise to the top of the charts? And what will he do when unthinkable disaster strikes?

(Source: HIDIVE)

Note: Episode 1【推しの子】Mother and Children was pre-screened in advance in Japanese theaters on March 17, 2023. The regular TV broadcast begins on April 12, 2023. The first episode has an extended runtime of ~90 minutes.

title: The Yakuza's Guide to Babysitting: Wholesome...just wholesome
author: iheartramen
summary: Prepare for an unexpected twist on the world of organized crime in 'The Yakuza's Guide to Babysitting.' This anime takes the tough and intimidating yakuza and turns them into unlikely, heartwarming babysitters. But is it worth your time? Let's find out.
content:
'The Yakuza's Guide to Babysitting' is a delightful departure from the typical yakuza-themed stories. Instead of focusing on gritty crime and violence, it opts for a heartwarming and often comedic approach. The story follows a grizzled yakuza boss who, after a series of events, finds himself responsible for taking care of a young child. The contrast between his tough exterior and the innocence of the child leads to numerous hilarious and touching moments.

The characters in this series are a real treat. The yakuza boss's transformation from a feared criminal to a caring guardian is beautifully portrayed. His interactions with the child, as he navigates the challenges of parenthood, are both heartwarming and genuinely funny. The supporting cast, including other yakuza members, adds depth and humor to the story.

The animation style is charming and suits the tone of the anime perfectly. While it may not boast the flashiest visuals, it excels in conveying the emotions and quirks of the characters. The simplicity of the art enhances the overall wholesome atmosphere.

One of the standout aspects of 'The Yakuza's Guide to Babysitting' is its ability to balance humor and sincerity. It can have you laughing out loud one moment and feeling genuinely touched the next. This emotional range makes it a unique and enjoyable watch.

However, it's essential to note that if you're seeking intense action or a deep exploration of the yakuza world, this anime may not meet your expectations. It's more about the transformation of its characters and the unlikely bonds that form between them.

In conclusion, 'The Yakuza's Guide to Babysitting' is a refreshing and heartwarming addition to the world of anime. It takes a familiar trope and infuses it with humor, sincerity, and a unique twist. If you're in the mood for a feel-good series with a touch of comedy and a dash of yakuza flavor, this anime is well worth your time. It's a wholesome journey that will leave you with a smile on your face.

title: Jujutsu Kaisen Season 2: No stitches yet?
author: icedAmericano
summary: Jujutsu Kaisen Season 2 returns with a resounding bang, delivering an electrifying continuation of the supernatural saga that captivated anime fans worldwide. Picking up where its predecessor left off, this season takes the already intense story to new heights, immersing viewers in a world of curses, exorcists, and breathtaking battles.
content:
The second season wastes no time in plunging us back into the action-packed world of jujutsu sorcery. Our protagonist, Yuji Itadori, continues to grapple with his dual existence as a vessel for the powerful curse Sukuna. With each episode, we witness his growth as both a jujutsu sorcerer and as an individual, wrestling with his newfound responsibilities and powers.

One of the standout aspects of Jujutsu Kaisen Season 2 is its character development. Not only does it deepen the backgrounds of existing characters like Megumi Fushiguro and Nobara Kugisaki, but it also introduces new, compelling faces to the mix. Each character feels fleshed out, with their unique motivations, fears, and desires driving the narrative forward. The bond between the members of Tokyo Metropolitan Jujutsu Technical High School continues to evolve, resonating emotionally with the audience and creating a strong sense of camaraderie.

The animation remains top-notch, maintaining the jaw-dropping quality that fans have come to expect from Jujutsu Kaisen. The fight sequences are a true highlight, fluidly choreographed and accompanied by striking visuals that leave viewers in awe. Studio MAPPA's dedication to capturing the manga's essence is evident, resulting in dynamic scenes that bring the battles to life with an unrivaled intensity.

Season 2 delves deeper into the complexities of the Cursed Wombs: Death Painting Arc, delivering a thrilling plot that keeps viewers on the edge of their seats. The villains are menacing and formidable, presenting formidable challenges for our heroes to overcome. The balance between action, drama, and humor is finely tuned, making for a well-paced and engaging storyline that never loses momentum.

As the plot unfolds, the series tackles darker themes, exploring the moral ambiguity and consequences of sorcery. This adds an extra layer of depth to the narrative, making it more than just a straightforward battle between good and evil. The exploration of human emotions, the burden of power, and the choices characters must make in the face of adversity gives the anime a maturity that distinguishes it from many others in the genre.

However, despite the brilliance of Jujutsu Kaisen Season 2, some viewers might find it difficult to keep up with the fast-paced storytelling. The constant introduction of new characters and concepts may be overwhelming for those not familiar with the manga or the first season. Nonetheless, the sheer excitement and allure of the series ultimately make up for this minor flaw.

In conclusion, Jujutsu Kaisen Season 2 is a resounding success, seamlessly continuing the legacy of its predecessor. With its spellbinding animation, well-developed characters, and gripping narrative, it firmly solidifies its place as a powerhouse in the world of supernatural anime. For both longtime fans and newcomers to the series, this season is a must-watch, promising an unforgettable journey filled with heart-pounding battles and emotional resonance.

title: Chainsaw Man: Should I Just Read It?
author: tanuki-san
summary: Chainsaw Man, the dark fantasy manga created by Tatsuki Fujimoto, has taken the manga and anime world by storm. With its unique blend of horror, action, and dark humor, Chainsaw Man has captured the hearts of many readers and viewers alike. But, you might be wondering, should you just read it? Let's dive into what makes Chainsaw Man so special.
content:
A Fresh and Gritty Premise: Chainsaw Man doesn't waste any time in getting to the point. It introduces you to a world where devils and devil hunters exist, and the protagonist, Denji, is transformed into the titular Chainsaw Man after a gruesome encounter with a devil. This chainsaw-wielding, demon-slaying hero has a simple yet captivating premise that immediately grabs your attention.

Complex Characters: What sets Chainsaw Man apart from many other manga series is its deeply flawed and complex characters. Denji is a far cry from the typical shonen hero - he's vulgar, morally ambiguous, and driven by his basic desires. Yet, you can't help but root for him as he navigates a world filled with danger and deceit.

Unpredictable Plot Twists: Chainsaw Man keeps you on the edge of your seat with its relentless plot twists. Just when you think you've got it figured out, the story takes a sharp turn, leaving you shocked and eager to see what happens next. This unpredictability is a hallmark of the series, making it incredibly engaging.

Artistry and Action: Tatsuki Fujimoto's artwork is nothing short of stunning. The action sequences are frenetic and bloody, delivering an adrenaline rush with each page turn. The horror elements are also brilliantly illustrated, creating a truly immersive experience.

Themes of Existence and Humanity: Chainsaw Man isn't just about gratuitous violence and gore; it explores deeper themes of existence and what it means to be human. It delves into the psychological struggles of its characters, adding layers of depth to the story.

Comedic Relief: Despite its dark themes, Chainsaw Man is surprisingly funny. The humor, often derived from the absurdity of the situations, provides a much-needed balance to the grim narrative.

Not for Everyone: While Chainsaw Man has garnered a dedicated fanbase, it's not for everyone. Its graphic violence, mature themes, and morally ambiguous characters can be off-putting to some readers. However, if you're open to exploring the darker side of storytelling, it's worth giving a shot.

In conclusion, Chainsaw Man is a manga that has earned its reputation for being bold, gritty, and unpredictable. If you're looking for a fresh take on the supernatural-action genre and are willing to embrace its darkness, then yes, you should absolutely read it. It's a rollercoaster of emotions that will keep you hooked from the very first chapter. Chainsaw Man is a testament to the power of manga to push boundaries and challenge conventions, and it's an experience that's well worth diving into.
